question.title: How can my company create Office 365 demos?
question.description: The Microsoft Office demo portal allows you to set up demonstration environments and access demonstration guide materials for Office products without requiring a full local installation. The Microsoft Office demo environment consists of a personalized Office 365 trial tenant populated with demo-ready content. Once your Office 365 tenant is set up, you can deliver effective demos that cover the full range of Office products, such as Exchange, SharePoint, Lync, Outlook, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and more.

question.title: What is the Cloud Services Partner Dashboard?
question.description: The Cloud Services Partner Dashboard helps resellers and distributors track the status of their customers’ subscriptions for Microsoft Office 365, Microsoft Intune, and Microsoft Dynamics CRM Online. You can use the dashboard as a source for key data to help you efficiently manage the subscriptions of customers who have designated your organization as their partner of record. With this data, you can more effectively and proactively drive demand, deployment, and renewals.

question.title: Can I purchase an Add-on subscription on top of my MPN IUR (Internal Use Rights) Online Services subscription?
question.description: No, this is not possible, you will need to purchase at least 1 license of a base subscription via the available purchasing channels to be able to add any Add-On. Exception: for CRM OL and Dynamics 365 Add-Ons – such as non-production instances and storage – you can submit your request here to get a free base subscription

link.text: Submit your request here to get a free base subscription
Product Usage Guide to Software and Cloud Services Benefits

question.title: How do I claim my Microsoft Azure internal-use rights (IUR) credit(s)?
question.description: All partners enrolled in a competency or Microsoft Action Pack have access to a Microsoft Azure monthly credit. This benefit is provided per organization regardless of the number of Action Pack subscriptions or Additional Benefit Toolkits purchased. If one of the administrators within an organization has already claimed the Azure benefit, other users in the same organization will not be able to claim it. To learn more about claiming your Microsoft Azure IUR benefit, the article below.

question.title: How do I manage the Visual Studio technical ID limits?

Action Pack partners can have their Visual Studio Online threshold increased to 360% of their subscription if they contact customer service. Use the resources below to learn more about increasing an Action Pack threshold to 360%.

question.title: Where do I download Windows 10 software and product keys?
question.description:
Partners with a Microsoft competency or Action Pack subscription can access their Windows 10 Enterprise software and product key for internal-use from the Partner Digital Distribution Portal. For development, testing, and evaluation purposes, partners can access software and keys with the Visual Studio Online subscription that they are granted as a program benefit. (These include the Pro and Home editions.) Access is limited to end users assigned to the Visual Studio Online subscription.
Note: Internal-use licenses for Windows 10 Enterprise are available as an upgrade only.
Note: The Software Download privilege is required to download software from the Digital Distribution Portal and the View Keys privilege is required to view the product. To access Visual Studio subscriber downloads, the Premium Subscriptions privilege is required for partners with a competency and the Technical Contact role is required for partners with an Action Pack subscription.
Note: Partners cannot use either existing Windows 8.1 or Windows 10 product keys to perform an in-place upgrade. Instead, a new key must be obtained from the Partner Digital Distribution Portal.

link.text: Partner Digital Distribution Portal
MPN Portal: Visual Studio Online subscriptions
Visual Studio Online download site

question.title: What is the Home Use Program?
question.description: The Home Use Program is a Software Assurance benefit available to Microsoft volume licensing customers with active Software Assurance coverage on their Office applications. Employees who use the covered licenses at work are eligible to purchase these Office applications for use on a personal device during the term of their employment.

link.text: Home Use Program

question.title: What resources are available for questions about Microsoft Products and Services Agreement (MPSA)?
question.description: The Microsoft Products and Services Agreement (MPSA) is a transactional licensing agreement for commercial, government, and academic organizations with 250 or more users/devices. MPSA works best for organizations that want to license Microsoft on-premises software, cloud services, or both as needed—with no organization-wide commitment under a single, non-expiring agreement.

link.text: MPSA Academy on Readiness Portals
Microsoft Products and Services Agreement
Volume Licensing Partner Center (Sign In required)

question.title: My company has qualifying Microsoft Certified Professionals (MCP) who are not recognized as fulfilling requirements for a silver or gold competency. What can I do?
question.description: After the recent program changes, you or your associated MCPs may not be correctly recognized in the Partner Membership Center, despite being linked correctly and passing the required exams. In this situation, please reassign the MCP through the “Manage Microsoft Certified Professionals” section in the Partner Membership Center. This workaround should solve the situation. If the issue still persists, please contact your local Regional Service Center for further assistance.

link.text: Partner Support Community post: Microsoft Certified Professional Management in the Partner Membership Center

question.title: Why are my customers not receiving an approval email after creating a customer reference in the Partner Membership Center?
question.description: We have simplified the enrollment and re-enrollment experience for silver and gold competency partners. Customer references are now automatically approved within 24 hours. If your references are not approved within 24 hours, please contact your Regional Service Center.

link.text: MPN Portal: Contact MPN Support

question.title: When can I expect to be moved from Partner Admin Center (PAC) to Partner Center?
question.description: Starting spring 2018, Office 365 Partner Admin Center (PAC) tool functionality is moving to the Microsoft Partner Center. You will be presented with a popup dialog box when available for the transfer to Partner Center. On transition day, each partner that attempts to access PAC will be automatically redirected and logged in to the Partner Center Dashboard. When the automatic redirection happens, Partners will no longer be able to access Partner Admin Center. Note to Advisors: currently, you can’t send Paid and Trial Quotes to customers through Partner Center. You can continue to use the Build your Business functionality in PAC until the Paid and Trial Quotes function is enabled in Partner Center.

link.text: Partner Center: Moving from Partner Admin Center (PAC) to Partner Center
Partner Center: Partner Admin Center is moving to Partner Center

question.title: How is my Azure consumption calculated for Cloud Platform Competency?
question.description: TTM consumption is calculated for the subscriptions who have DPOR attached. In case a partner owns some subscriptions, this is not enough. Partner has to be attached as DPOR for the owned subscriptions. The consumption will be calculated only from the date DPOR is attached.

link.text: MPN Portal: Cloud Platform

Partners will also see details on most of the cloud incentives, even if they haven’t attained the required competencies yet.

MPN Portal: Contact Partner Incentives Support (select Partner incentives as Category)
Partner Center: Understand your incentive payouts

question.title: How can I become eligible to earn partner incentives?
question.description: Eligibility for partner incentives varies by program. Some programs look at Microsoft Partner Network competency attainment. Some evaluate partner performance or Microsoft channel authorization status. Not all partners will be eligible for all incentives.

link.text: MPN Portal: MPN memebers can sign in to Partner Membersip Center to see incentives information

question.title: How can I receive incentives for selling and deploying Microsoft Cloud Solutions?
question.description: Access resources that can help you get started with online services incentives and learn what to do if you have questions about your fee statement or the payment process.

link.text: KB 3082022: Incentives for selling and deploying Microsoft Cloud Solutions

question.title: How do I get support for partner incentives?
question.description: You can find support for the Partner Incentives program under the Support section on the Partner Incentives page.

link.text: MPN Portal: Get support for partner incentives
MPN Portal: View the new Partner Incentives page

question.title: How to update my Banking and Tax information?
question.description: See the articleS below to learn how to update your banking and tax information

link.text: KB 3073470: How to add bank details for Azure Incentives

KB 3011099: Where Do I Update My Tax Details

question.title: What are Microsoft partner incentives?
question.description: Take advantage of partner incentives to drive revenue. If your business focuses on certain strategic activities and solution areas, you could be eligible to earn incentives.

link.text: MPN Portal: Partner incentives
Partner Center: Understand your incentive payouts

question.title: Where can I get assistance with an issue or questions about Dynamics products?
question.description: Please log a service request via Partner Source. This can be done by visiting the Pricing and Ordering section of the site and selecting New Operations Request. Please quote an IT number as part of the request or chat directly with an agent via chat. If your request is not resolved to your satisfaction please email Dynamics Escalation including IT number in the email body.

link.text: Dynamics PartnerSource

question.title: Are there community forums available for Microsoft Azure, Microsoft Dynamics 365, or Office 365 that can be utilized for technical product related questions?
question.description: Yes! There are multiple community forums available for answering technical product related questions.

link.text: Microsoft Azure Community
Microsoft Dynamics 365 Community
Office 365 Community

question.title: How do I create Support Requests for Office 365, Microsoft Azure, or Microsoft Dynamics 365, for either for my organization or on behalf of a customer?
question.description: Product support requests can be submitted from each of these portals.

link.text: Office 365 Support (Sign in required)
Microsoft Azure Support (Sign in required)
Microsoft Dynamics 365 Support (Sign in required)

question.title: Where can I find the top questions asked by partners during the presales and deployment phases of cloud and hybrid customer projects?
question.description: Review the most commonly asked questions by partners during the presales and deployment phases of their customer projects—including competitive positioning, demos, configuration, technical licensing, migration and deployment, and app development.

link.text: KB 3182623: Top Partner Product Questions

question.title: What is a technical journey? Why is it important to my partner organization?
question.description: Technical journeys help you build your technical capabilities faster to accelerate sales, deployments and app development. Start your technical journey to receive technical guidance from Microsoft partner technical consultants through a recommended path of interactive technical webinars and personalized consultations with virtual white-boarding, architecture reviews and shadowing of real-world scenarios.

link.text: Start your technical journey
Read blog

question.title: How do I engage with Microsoft Partner Technical Consultants throughout the technical journey?
question.description: There are three ways to engage across the technical journey: technical webinars, technical consultations, and live chat (for app dev.)

link.text: Learn more
Start a Dev Chat

question.title: What MPN benefits do I leverage to access the technical journeys?
question.description: As an MPN partner, you receive unlimited access to remote, technical webinars, and unlimited access to Dev Chat offered as part of the technical journey. To engage in a one-to-one technical consultation via Skype for Business, you will leverage your Technical Presales Assistance or Partner Advisory Hours benefit.

link.text: View MPN technical presales and deployment services benefits
Read blog
Start your technical journey

question.title: Where can I find information about competency related exams and readiness?
question.description: For information regarding competency exams and readiness, please visit the Microsoft partner learning paths page below.

link.text: Microsoft partner learning paths

question.title: Does Microsoft offer low or no-cost training?
question.description: Training is a benefit available to organizations enrolled in the Microsoft Partner Network at any level. MPN provides registration and access to online and in-person low and no-cost training. It is also used to complete the assessment requirements for Microsoft Action Pack and competencies.

link.text: MPN Portal: Technical training for presales and deployment scenarios
MPN Portal: Microsoft partner learning paths
Partner University

question.title: What are the top asked questions about Learning Paths?
question.description: Learning paths can help you get trained or certified. Learning paths highlight the paths that are relevant to your company, or organization. The Learning Paths FAQ provides answers to the top asked questions about Learning Paths.

link.text: KB 2964426: Learning Paths – Top FAQ list
MPN Portal: Microsoft partner learning paths
Partner University
